channel.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
channel.description: Is there a way I can make it so [b]THE[/b] script ends after certain ammount of time? example, say i run [b]THE[/b] script, i would want it to end after 1:11 (one mins 11 seconds) there a way i can do this? please respond a.s.a.p. :o :D Happy? Jerk

item.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I_Live_2_0wn:

Is there a way I can make it so my script ends after certain ammount of time? example, say i run my script, i would want it to end after 1:11

[quote=“I_Live_2_0wn, post:5, topic:107926”]My script right now is:
(Not COMPLETELY mine i added edits, and now working on the time)[/quote]
so therefor:

wow u retard u totally ignore whole post go spam elsewhere
you are an incompetent moron. my post had not one word of spam in it, and I would highly doubt that I have a mental illness as a result to [b]your[/b] stupidity.

now please stop flaming yourself. the result won’t be a good one. All i ask is that you give credit where credit is due, and don’t say any of this is yours; Because it isn’t, and about 4 people told you how to fix it step by step.

Sorry, now lets get back on topic here.

item.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
item.dc:creator: @I_Live_2_0wn I_Live_2_0wn
item.description:
@I_Live_2_0wn wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:9, topic:107926”][quote author=KyleGut3 link=topic=5366.msg54381#msg54381 date=1151435297]

program New; begin repeat KeyDown(GetKeyCode('v')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('x')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('n')); Sleep(65); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('v')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('x')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('n')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('b')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('c')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('m')); Sleep(65); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('b')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('m')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('c')); until(False); end.
[/quote]

So remind me, what part of this script did you ‘make’ again?

If you consider adding directions to be edits to a script, you are sadly mistaken.[/quote]
wow u retard u totally ignore whole post go spam elsewhere

item.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

This? Stops loop after 1 minute.

[code]
program New;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

var
TheTimer : Integer;

begin
SetupSRL;
MarkTime(TheTimer);
repeat
KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘v’));
KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘x’));
KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘n’));
wait(50);
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(‘v’));
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(‘x’));
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(‘n’));
KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘b’));
KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘c’));
KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘m’));
wait(65);
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(‘b’));
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(‘m’));
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(‘c’));
until(TimeFromMark(TheTimer)) >= 60000);
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
item.dc:creator: @I_Live_2_0wn I_Live_2_0wn
item.description:
@I_Live_2_0wn wrote:

Script right now is:

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// //// Tug - O - War //// //// //// //// 1)Start the game "Tug-o-War" //// //// 2)Don't edit the size of the game! //// //// 3)Pull the SCAR script size down so all u see is play, and put//// //// it under the game. (for easy contact) //// //// 4)Drag the crosshair onto the screen //// //// 5)Press 1 player //// //// 6)Choose a player //// //// 7)Begin the match and click on the'play'on SCAR then click the//// //// game screen //// //// NOTE: Stop at around level 10, or the Staff gets suspicious! //// ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// program New; begin repeat KeyDown(GetKeyCode('v')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('x')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('n')); wait(50); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('v')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('x')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('n')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('b')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('c')); KeyDown(GetKeyCode('m')); wait(65); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('b')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('m')); KeyUp(GetKeyCode('c')); until(false) end.
(Not COMPLETELY mine im adding edits, now working on the time)

So can u tell EXACTLY where they go then i know for future

Read full topic
item.source: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?

item.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

way at the beginning of your script, declare a variable

var scriptTime: Integer;

Then in the beginning of your main loop write MarkTime(ScriptTime); repeat
and write your script in there.
Then once you’re all done, add an until(TimefromMark(ScriptTime) >71000); //71000 being 1 minute 11 seconds. end.

If you still don’t understand that, then I suggest you read more tutorials on how to script. Get yourself familiar with the simple things first, then you can attempt more difficult ones.

Read full topic

item.source: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?

item.title: How to end script automaticly after (x) amount of time?
item.dc:creator: @existingqwer existingqwer
item.description:
@existingqwer wrote:

Make sure you’re including SRL at the beginning of the script.

Make a variable called “Time” or something like that.

Then at the beginning of your main loop put this:

MarkTime(Time)

At the end of your script you’re probably using “until(false)”
Change false to "TimeFromMark(Time>b)
b being how many milliseconds to run the script.

Read full topic
